message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.LG 

This paper deals with the analysis of social media data, specifically hashtags, and proposes a context-aware approach to segment and link entities in hashtags to a knowledge base. This involves natural language processing techniques such as entity linking and sentiment analysis, which are commonly studied in the sub-categories of computational linguistics (cs.CL) and information retrieval (cs.IR). Additionally, the paper also deals with semantic coherence and maximizing the coherence between hashtag semantics and the tweet, which could fall under the sub-category of social and information networks (cs.SI). The paper also mentions the use of state-of-the-art social media analytics systems, which could be related to the sub-category of software engineering (cs.SE). Finally, the paper evaluates its method on two different datasets, which could be related to the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG).
